org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy

Class Proxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.Proxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    @WebServlet(urlPatterns="/proxy/*")
public class Proxy
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    A servlet that proxies HTTP requests to another server and handles the response.
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • handleProxyRequest

        private void handleProxyRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest servletRequest,
                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse servletResponse)
                         throws InvalidPartnerException
        Handle a request by configuring the request, authorizing it, then proxying or refusing it.
        Parameters:
        servletRequest - the HTTP servlet request
        servletResponse - the HTTP servlet response
        Throws:
        InvalidPartnerException - when the API returns no partner

      • logRequest

        private void logRequest(java.lang.String uri,
              java.lang.String ip,
              java.lang.String credentialId,
              java.lang.String sessionId)
        Log a request, but only if it is not an embedded request contained in a full page (images, js, css, and so on).
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI to log
        ip - the IP address to log
        credentialId - the party ID of the user, if logged in
        sessionId - the session ID of the partner session, if any

      • authorizeAndProxy

        private void authorizeAndProxy(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest servletRequest,
                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse servletResponse,
                     java.lang.String uri,
                     java.lang.String partnerId,
                     org.apache.http.HttpHost targetHost,
                     org.apache.http.HttpHost sourceHost,
                     java.lang.String fullRequestUri,
                     java.lang.String remoteIp,
                     java.lang.String credentialId,
                     java.lang.String secretKey)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               UnsupportedHttpMethodException,
                               javax.servlet.ServletException
        Authorize the request, and if authorized, proxy it.
        Parameters:
        servletRequest - the HTTP servlet request to proxy
        servletResponse - the HTTP servlet response to set
        uri - the request URI
        partnerId - the API ID for the partner
        targetHost - the host to which to proxy
        sourceHost - the host being proxied
        fullRequestUri - the transformed URI for the proxy request
        remoteIp - the user's IP address
        credentialId - the user's party id if logged in
        secretKey - the user's secret key for authentication
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a URI problem
        UnsupportedHttpMethodException - when the requested method is not GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, OPTIONS
        javax.servlet.ServletException - when proxying fails

      • buildFullUri

        private java.lang.String buildFullUri(java.lang.String path,
                            java.lang.String query,
                            org.apache.http.HttpHost sourceHost)
        Build the full URI for proxying based on the transformed source host.
        Parameters:
        path - the URI path information
        query - the URI query parameters
        sourceHost - the HTTP host for the source being proxied
        Returns:
        the transformed URI

      • isEmbeddedFile

        private boolean isEmbeddedFile(java.lang.String fullRequestUri)
        Detect whether a URI is an "embedded" file by comparing the end of the string to a list of extensions like ".jpg" or ".js".
        Parameters:
        fullRequestUri - the full URI
        Returns:
        true if the URI contains an "embedded" extension, otherwise false

      • authorizeProxyRequest

        private java.lang.Boolean authorizeProxyRequest(java.lang.String secretKey,
                                      java.lang.String partnerId,
                                      java.lang.String credentialId,
                                      java.lang.String fullUri,
                                      java.lang.String remoteIp,
                                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse servletResponse,
                                      java.lang.StringBuilder userIdentifier)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Authorize the request based on the information in the HttpServletRequest. Returns true if the servletRequest is allowed to access partner's server, and false otherwise. Redirection path in servletResponse will be set if the client does not allow to access partner's server.
        Parameters:
        secretKey - client's password-based key to use for authentication
        partnerId - partner associated with client's request
        credentialId - client's partyId to use for authentication
        fullUri - client's full request path. example: https://test.arabidopsis.org/test/test.html
        remoteIp - client's IP address
        servletResponse - client's response to be modified if ther request to partner's server is denied.
        userIdentifier - the by-reference object that will contain the output user identifier for the credentialed user
        Returns:
        Boolean indicates if client has access to partner' server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sendRequestToServer

        private void sendRequestToServer(org.apache.http.HttpHost host,
                       org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest request,
                       javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                       org.apache.http.client.ResponseHandler<java.lang.String> responseHandler,
                       java.lang.String userIdentifier)
                          throws org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException,
                                 java.io.IOException

        Send the HTTP request to the target server. Set the appropriate cookie for session handling.

        PB-128: The client must not do any redirect handling; it should leave that to the actual client browser.

        Parameters:
        request - the URI request to send to the server
        session - the HTTP session containing a possible cookie store
        responseHandler - the response handler for the request
        userIdentifier - the id string the partner uses to identify the user
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem handling the URI or redirecting
        org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException - when there is a syntax error in the URI

      • configureProxyRequest

        private void configureProxyRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest servletRequest,
                         ProxyRequest proxyRequest,
                         org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest requestToProxy,
                         java.lang.String userIdentifier)
        Configure the various settings in the proxy request: the proxy request itself, the redirect context, the request headers, and the forwarded header.
        Parameters:
        servletRequest - the HTTP servlet request
        proxyRequest - the proxy request to configure
        requestToProxy - the HTTP request to proxy to the target

      • proxy

        private void proxy(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse servletResponse,
         ProxyRequest proxyRequest,
         org.apache.http.HttpHost host,
         java.lang.String userIdentifier)
            throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Proxy the request.
        Parameters:
        session - the HTTP session, for setting the cookie store
        servletResponse - the servlet response to send to the client
        proxyRequest - the proxy request
        host - the host to which to set the HOST header, the target host
        userIdentifier - the partner identifier for the user
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - when there is a servlet problem, including URI syntax or handling issues

      • copyProxyResponseToServletResponse

        private void copyProxyResponseToServletResponse(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                      org.apache.http.HttpResponse proxyResponse)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Copy the response headers and entity to the servlet response.
        Parameters:
        response - the HTTP servlet response to return to the client
        proxyResponse - the response from the proxy target
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem copying the headers or entity

      • handleSetCookieRequest

        private void handleSetCookieRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest servletRequest,
                          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse servletResponse)

        Parameters:

      • handleOptionsRequest

        private void handleOptionsRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse servletResponse)
        Set the headers appropriate to responding to an OPTIONS request.
        Parameters:
        servletResponse - the HTTP response

      • copyResponseHeaders

        protected void copyResponseHeaders(org.apache.http.HttpResponse proxyResponse,
                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Copy proxied response headers back to the servlet client. Skip any hop-by-hop headers or cookies. Stripping cookies ensures that no cookies set between the Proxy and Target servers affects the cookies sent from Proxy to Client.
        Parameters:
        proxyResponse - the proxied server response
        response - the servlet response

      • copyResponseEntity

        protected void copyResponseEntity(org.apache.http.HttpResponse proxyResponse,
                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Copy response body data (the entity) from the proxy to the servlet client. Ignore any errors. PB-191: rewrote to use stream approach.
        Parameters:
        proxyResponse - the response from the proxied server
        response - the servlet response

      • getIpAddress

        public static java.lang.String getIpAddress(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Get the remote IP address of the requester from the request. This method gets, in order, the Remote_Addr header value, the x-forwarded-for header value, or the HTTP request remote address. If the resulting string is a list of comma-separated IP addresses, take the last one in the list.
        Parameters:
        request - the HTTP servlet request containing the IP address
        Returns:
        the remote IP address

      • canonicalizeIpAddress

        public static java.lang.String canonicalizeIpAddress(java.lang.String ipAddress)
        Produce a standard IP address with no leading or trailing blanks. If the input string is a comma-delimited list of addresses, the result will be the last address in the list.
        Parameters:
        ipAddress - an IP address or list of IP addresses
        Returns:
        a single IP address with no leading or trailing blanks

      • printAllRequestHeaders

        public static void printAllRequestHeaders(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Prints out all headers of a HttpServletRequest object
        Parameters:
        request - the HTTP servlet request whose header is to print out

      • printAllResponseHeaders

        public static void printAllResponseHeaders(org.apache.http.HttpResponse response)
        Prints out all headers of a HttpResponse object
        Parameters:
        response - the HTTP response whose header is to print out

      • handleResponseHeaders

        public static void handleResponseHeaders(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse clientResponse,
                         org.apache.http.HttpResponse proxyResponse)
        Checks for special authentication-related headers in a partner's response and adjusts authentication-related cookies appropriately.
        Parameters:
        clientResponse - the HTTP servlet response being set
        proxyResponse - the HTTP response from the proxying

      • addCookie

        private static void addCookie(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
             javax.servlet.http.Cookie cookie)
        Add a cookie to a servlet response, setting the cookie domain.
        Parameters:
        response - the servlet response
        cookie - the cookie to add
